CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Expulsion) (Conditional) (Kyrgyzstan);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Review of lawfulness of detention);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Dmitry Dedov;Helen Keller;Helena Jäderblom;Johannes Silvis;Luis López Guerra;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE . He is currently detained in a special facility for temporary detention of foreign nationals in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is an ethnic NORP who lived in PERSON , GPE . In DATE the region was a scene of mass disorders and inter - ethnic clashes between ethnic NORP and NORP .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant was present at the barricades raised by ethnic NORP near GPE . On DATE he was wounded by a Molotov cocktail and was admitted to hospital on account of severe burns . He was released from hospital on DATE .
CARDINAL . Eventually the applicant fled GPE to GPE , together with many other ethnic NORP , to avoid ethnically motivated violence .

CARDINAL . In DATE the NORP authorities opened a criminal case against the applicant charging him with a number of violent crimes allegedly committed in the course of the riots of DATE . On DATE ORG in the PERSON - Abad region ordered in absentia the applicant ’s detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested in GPE because he was not carrying an identity document . He was placed in the Special Facility for ORG , GPE ( “ the detention centre for aliens ” ) , run by ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , GPE ( “ the district court ” ) found the applicant guilty of an administrative offence punishable under LAW ( “ breach of rules on entry and stay of foreign nationals in GPE , GPE , GPE and the GPE Region ” ) of LAW ( “ the CAO ” ) and sentenced him as follows : “ [ ... ] a punishment in the form of an administrative fine in the amount of MONEY ( RUB ) [ combined ] with administrative removal and placement in the centre for detention of foreign nationals , [ where he will remain ] until the entry into force of that decision and until administrative removal from GPE under LAW ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against ORG decision arguing that in GPE he would be subjected to illtreatment like many other ethnic NORP . It appears that the appeal documentation reached ORG on DATE . The appeal hearing was scheduled for DATE but was then postponed until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG granted the applicant ’s request for interim measures and indicated to the ORG that the applicant should not be expelled or otherwise involuntarily removed from GPE to GPE or another country for the duration of the proceedings before the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s relatives were told by the officials of the detention centre for aliens that the applicant would be expelled from GPE on DATE . At TIME the applicant contacted his lawyer stating that he was in FAC in GPE . At TIME the lawyer arrived at the airport and was informed by the border control personnel that the applicant had not boarded the plane scheduled for GPE , GPE . State bailiffs informed the lawyer that the applicant had been brought to PERSON but had later been returned to the detention centre for aliens . At TIME a duty officer of the detention centre confirmed to the lawyer that the applicant was back in the facility .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Appeal Court ” ) upheld ORG decision of DATE on appeal . ORG dismissed the applicant ’s allegations of the risk of illtreatment stating that “ the documents submitted by the [ applicant ’s ] defence d[id ] not demonstrate a breach of rights and freedoms of the person in question ” and reasoned that “ [ a]ssessment of actions by law - enforcement agencies of a foreign ORG , as well as of [ legal ] acts carried out by them f[ell ] outside the subject - matter jurisdiction of a court examining a case concerning an administrative offence committed in GPE by a foreign national ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Government informed the ORG that “ the proceedings on the administrative removal of the applicant have been suspended ” and that the applicant “ continues to be held in the detention centre for foreign nationals of the GPE department of ORG ” ( “ the GPE FMS ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied for refugee status arguing that in GPE he would face persecution based on his ethnic origin .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for refugee status . The parties have not provided the ORG with a copy of the decision .
CARDINAL . The applicant challenged the decision before ORG , GPE . The proceedings are pending .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , on DATE he was severely beaten by officers of a special police squad in the detention centre for aliens . He received rubber - truncheon blows to his back , buttocks and heels .
CARDINAL . The applicant notified his lawyer accordingly and provided mobile phone photos of his injured back .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL lawyers visited the applicant along with several other persons awaiting expulsion in the detention centre for aliens . The applicant and other detainees informed them that regular beatings of detainees had begun on DATE following unsuccessful suicide attempts by several inmates . The applicant claimed that the officers of the special police squad had beaten him on DATE with rubber truncheons on his back , heels and buttocks .

CARDINAL . On DATE the lawyers reported the beatings to the main investigative department of ORG . They emphasised that the medical staff of the detention centre had refused to enter the detainees’ injuries into the medical logs . The lawyers requested that the beatings of the detainees , including the applicant , be investigated . In support of their request they enclosed , among other things , the applicant ’s photos showing injuries to his back .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG complaint was forwarded to the NORP district investigation department of ORG .
CARDINAL . It appears that no investigation into the applicant ’s alleged beatings in the detention centre for aliens has been instituted .
